Executive Summary
One-page executive summary including:
 Brief information on the main engineering activities of the company;
 Explanation of major internship activities you carried out: highlight the type of work
you have done, and the project/work that you were engaged in during your internship;
 Summary of your expectations from the internship and the actual outcomes of it;
 Brief statement of what you have learned and benefited from your experience.
Format: Calibri, 11pt, Single space
Ozan Electronics is a leading company in the field of financial technologies, focusing on
payment systems, data analytics, software development, and financial solutions. The
company's engineering activities include the development of highly secure payment
infrastructures, customer data analysis and optimization, as well as financial software
integrations. During my internship in the Finance and Accounting department, I supported
financial reporting processes and played an active role in budgeting and cost analysis projects.
Throughout this period, I learned fundamental tasks such as collecting, organizing, and
analyzing financial data. My expectation from the internship was to gain practical experience
in finance and accounting processes. I largely met these expectations and had the opportunity
to improve myself in areas such as process management, professional communication skills,
and teamwork. I acquired important technical knowledge in preparing financial statements
and the effective use of data analysis techniques. Additionally, I developed competencies in
workplace discipline, time management, and problem-solving. This internship experience has
been a significant step toward my career goals and has provided valuable lessons that will
guide me in my future professional life.

General report formatting rules (applies to all sections):
o Format: Sections 16 pt.; subsections 13 pt. and text single space, Calibri, 11pt.
justified.
o Charts, Figures and Diagrams should be numbered, captioned, and cited in the text.
o All visual material (charts, figures, diagrams, etc.) must be of sufficiently high quality
when printed.
o Information/large charts, figures, diagrams and source codes too bulky for inclusion
in the main report can be given in the Appendix.
o Unless specifically indicated in the Program Internship Guidelines, referencing and
citation should be made according to the Harvard Referencing Guide.

1. Company and Sector (maximum ten pages)
This part should be a self-contained report in a continuous text format.
a. Overview of the Company and Sector (maximum two pages)
Give the full name of the company and its brief history including full mailing address and
relevant web links.
Indicate ownership type, area (indoors and outdoors), number of employees (blue collar, white
collar), number of XX Engineers, products/services, production/service capacity, sales volume,
market shares and competitors, suppliers and customers (domestic and/or international)
Indicate and explain the sector company operates in.
Specify the work done by the company in the sector.
Ozan Electronics is a Turkish company operating in the field of financial technologies. The
company's headquarters is located in Istanbul, Turkey. Founded in 2016, Ozan Electronics has
quickly become one of Turkey's leading fintech firms. The company's main office is situated in
Kadıköy.
Ozan Electronics is a privately-owned company providing services in indoor environments.
The company employs over 300 people, with 200 white-collar and 100 blue-collar workers.
More than 50 engineers work within the company, specializing in software development, data
analysis, and payment systems. Ozan Electronics offers a range of financial solutions and
payment services, focusing on software development and data processing. The company
holds a significant market share in the industry with its annual sales volume. Major
competitors include other large domestic fintech firms and international payment system
providers. The company serves both local and international customers, with suppliers
primarily consisting of domestic technology and software firms.
Ozan Electronics operates in the fintech sector, which focuses on integrating technology with
financial services and providing digital solutions. This sector aims to offer faster, more secure,
and user-friendly solutions compared to traditional financial services. In this sector, Ozan
Electronics stands out, particularly in payment systems and digital wallet services. The
company is involved in significant projects, such as mobile payment solutions, online
collection systems, and digital banking. These services facilitate users' daily financial
transactions and strengthen the company's position in the sector. Ozan Electronics has made
significant contributions to Turkey's fintech ecosystem and has become recognized for its
innovative solutions in the industry.

Describe the production/service system by preparing a chart that shows the relations
between the major components (marketing, manufacturing, finance, purchasing, sales, etc.)

The production and service system of Ozan Electronics is organized to suit the company's
size and scope of operations, with key components including Marketing, Software
Development, Finance, Purchasing, Sales, and Operations. The Marketing department
identifies customer needs, markets new and existing services, and channels the feedback
into product development processes. The Software Development department is responsible
for developing the software products and services offered by the company, while working
closely with the Finance department to ensure the efficient use of financial resources and
with Marketing to deliver features that align with market trends. The Finance department
manages budgeting, forecasting, and cost management, coordinating with all departments
to ensure the effective use of financial resources. The Purchasing department procures the
necessary software, hardware, and services for product development and service delivery,
collaborating closely with Software Development and Finance for cost management. The
Sales department drives revenue, manages customer relationships, and formulates
strategies based on market demand. The Operations department manages daily activities,
ensuring seamless service delivery and maintaining customer satisfaction.
One of Ozan Electronics' flagship services, the Digital Wallet Service, operates through a
well-defined process. First, customers register through the mobile app, followed by data
verification processes, and account creation. Customers can then link a bank account or
credit card to add funds to the wallet and proceed with payments. Payments are completed
by sending transaction details to the payment gateway and confirming the transaction. In
this process, efficient backend systems minimize processing times through quick and
accurate data verification, while a user-friendly interface enhances customer satisfaction.
However, manual intervention required in some verification processes and occasional delays
in customer support are identified as less efficient elements.

d. Professional and Ethical Responsibilities of Engineers (minimum one
page)
What are the professional and ethical responsibilities of XX Engineers in the company? What
are the professional and ethical standards used in the company? Is there an ethics code or
code of conduct? Please explain by considering the professional activities that you observe in
the company.
At Ozan Electronics, engineers are expected to adhere to high professional and ethical
standards, which are vital in the fintech industry. Their professional responsibilities include
ensuring the accuracy, reliability, and security of their work, adhering to industry standards,
and engaging in continuous professional development. They must design and implement
solutions that are safe, secure, and compliant with legal requirements.
Ethically, engineers are responsible for protecting customer data confidentiality and
avoiding conflicts of interest. They are expected to be transparent, report issues promptly,
and take responsibility for their actions. The company enforces a code of conduct that
outlines expectations for professional integrity, intellectual property respect, and non-
discriminatory practices.
During my internship, I observed engineers conducting rigorous testing and ensuring
compliance with data protection and financial regulations. The company also emphasizes
continuous learning, with engineers regularly updating their skills to align with industry
advancements. In summary, engineers at Ozan Electronics are guided by a strong ethical
framework, ensuring they maintain the highest standards in their professional activities.

2. Summer Practice Description (maximum fifteen pages)

sections.section_name:
Firstly, present the main list of activities performed during the summer practice and their
explanations in detail. Provide relevant technical information and references on equipment,
tools, processes, etc. that you have observed and/or used. While doing that, indicate
 XX Engineering related tasks you performed;
 the relationship of the work to your major studies;
 how interesting and challenging it was; and
 what you have learned and benefited from your experience
During my internship at Ozan Electronics, I engaged in various activities closely related to my
studies in Industrial Engineering. One of my primary tasks was to support the financial
reporting processes; in this role, I collected data, verified financial statements, and prepared
internal reports using Excel and LOGO software. This task required meticulous attention to
detail and a solid understanding of financial principles, providing me with valuable experience
in applying theoretical knowledge to real-world scenarios. Additionally, I contributed to
budgeting and cost analysis activities, where I calculated expenses, compared them to the
budget, and identified discrepancies. Using LOGO and spreadsheet tools for these tasks
allowed me to gain a better understanding of the budgeting process within a large
organization and was closely related to my courses in operations management and cost
accounting.
Furthermore, I participated in process improvement initiatives within the Finance and
Accounting department. My role involved analyzing current workflows, identifying
inefficiencies, and proposing solutions to enhance efficiency. I used flowchart software to map
out processes and collaborated with team members to develop practical improvements. This
task was directly related to my industrial engineering education, particularly in process
optimization and workflow management, and it provided me with a challenging and engaging
experience as I worked through complex problems to find effective solutions.
The practical experience I gained during this internship allowed me to see the direct
applicability of the theories and techniques I learned in class, reinforcing my knowledge in
areas such as financial analysis, budgeting, and process optimization. I also gained hands-on
experience with industry-standard tools like LOGO and Excel, deepening my understanding of
the finance and accounting functions within a tech-driven company like Ozan Electronics.
Overall, this internship was an educational and beneficial experience that helped bridge the
gap between academic knowledge and practical application, significantly boosting my
confidence in my abilities as an industrial engineer.
Additionally, I undertook a project aimed at optimizing the monthly financial closing process,
where I mapped out the existing process and identified inefficiencies. This project reinforced
my knowledge of process improvement. My overall experience at Ozan Electronics offered
significant learning opportunities and contributed to my professional development.
 Activity Analysis
 Describe a XX Engineering activity that you have either observed or have been a part
of during your internship and describe this activity in detail.
 Determine and explain relevant performance indicators/metrics/measures by
providing and interpreting related data/information.

 Point out problematic issues about the current situation by analyzing related
data/information.
Activity can be a software development, a hardware unit design, a manufacturing process, a
building construction, an industrial operation, an information flow, a decision-making process,
etc.
 During my internship, one of the key activities I was involved in was the process of
managing and organizing financial documents, particularly related to the entry and
reconciliation of invoices and expenses. This included gathering electronic invoices,
payment receipts, and other financial documents from emails and categorizing
them appropriately. Additionally, I entered both domestic and foreign invoices into
the LOGO software, ensuring accuracy and compliance with financial regulations.
Another key task was preparing expense forms in Excel based on collected data,
which were later used to generate invoices in LOGO.
 Performance Indicators/ Metrics:
 Invoice Accuracy: Ensuring that the entered invoices, whether domestic or foreign,
were accurate with no discrepancies in amounts, dates, or vendor details. This was
measured by comparing the data in LOGO with the original documents and cross-
referencing them with expense reports.
 Timeliness: The speed at which invoices and financial documents were processed
and categorized. Delays in entry could impact monthly financial closures.
 Reconciliation Success: Matching invoices with corresponding receipts or financial
documents to ensure that all records were accurate and up to date. Any mismatch
required further investigation.
 Data Integrity in Excel: Accuracy in preparing the expense forms and organizing data
for report generation. This was tracked by reviewing the Excel sheets and ensuring
formulas and data inputs were correctly implemented.
 Problematic Issues:
 Data Entry Errors: One of the issues observed was occasional data entry mistakes
when inputting invoices into LOGO, which could lead to incorrect financial records.
These errors usually occurred when details were misinterpreted or overlooked
during manual entry.
 Communication Delays: When documents were missing or incomplete, it was
necessary to request them from managers or staff. Delays in communication caused
interruptions in the workflow, affecting the timeliness of financial closures.
 Foreign Invoice Complexity: Entering foreign invoices required extra attention due
to differences in currency conversion, tax regulations, and language barriers. These
complexities introduced a higher risk of errors compared to domestic invoices.
 Through this process, I was able to identify key areas for improvement, such as
adopting automated tools for invoice entry and establishing more streamlined
communication channels to reduce delays in document gathering.

of during your internship and describe this activity in detail.
 Determine and explain relevant performance indicators/metrics/measures by
providing and interpreting related data/information.

improvement/solution approaches that can be adopted for your work.

reporting, budgeting, and cost analysis, where I used tools like Excel and LOGO
software to support financial operations. Additionally, I contributed to process
improvement initiatives by analyzing workflows and recommending enhancements.

environment at Ozan Electronics was dynamic and collaborative, with a strong

analytics, and the Internet of Things are expected to drive innovations in products
and services. For example, AI and machine learning will enhance financial analysis
and fraud detection, while big data analytics will enable more precise market
predictions and personalized financial services.

a. Impact (minimum one page)

sections.section_name:
Engineering students should develop an understanding of the impact of engineering solutions
in a global, economic, environmental and societal context.
Explain the possible global, economic, environmental and societal impacts of the engineering
solution/activity you have described above / observed during your internship.

The engineering activities I observed and participated in during my internship have various
impacts in global, economic, environmental, and societal contexts. Understanding how these
activities influence these four areas has provided me with a deeper insight into the broad
effects of engineering solutions.
Global Impact: The financial technologies developed by Ozan Electronics have the potential
to accelerate and simplify financial transactions on a global scale. For instance, digital
payment systems enable seamless cross-border financial transactions, contributing
positively to the growth of e-commerce and international trade. Additionally, the
advancement of financial technologies increases access to global markets, supports financial
inclusion, and creates new opportunities for individuals and small businesses, particularly in
developing countries.
Economic Impact: Activities such as financial process optimization and cost analysis help
companies reduce costs and increase profitability. These engineering solutions, which
enhance efficiency, boost the competitiveness of companies and contribute to economic
growth. Moreover, improvements in budgeting and cost management processes lead to
more efficient use of resources, supporting the operational sustainability of the company.
These economic impacts contribute to the growth of the company and its ability to maintain
a competitive advantage in the industry.
Environmental Impact: The environmental impact of engineering solutions should also be
considered. For example, process improvement activities can lead to more efficient use of
resources, reducing energy consumption and waste production. This supports
environmental sustainability and reduces the company’s carbon footprint. The adoption of
eco-friendly practices by technology companies like Ozan Electronics contributes to
increased environmental awareness and the proliferation of sustainable business models.
Societal Impact: The societal impact of financial technologies is also significant. The
widespread adoption of digital payment systems and financial services increases financial
accessibility, allowing a broader range of people to benefit from these services. This is
especially advantageous for individuals who have limited or no access to banking services.
Additionally, engineering solutions that increase workforce efficiency improve working
conditions and raise employee satisfaction. These societal impacts highlight the importance
of addressing engineering solutions not only from an economic perspective but also with a
sense of social responsibility.
In evaluating these four main areas, it is clear that engineering activities do not merely solve
technical problems but also have wide-ranging impacts globally, economically,
environmentally, and socially. The understanding I gained during my internship at Ozan
Electronics has enhanced my ability to assess the multifaceted effects of engineering
solutions.

activities influence these four areas has provided me with a deeper insight into the broad
effects of engineering solutions.
Global Impact: The financial technologies developed by Ozan Electronics have the potential
to accelerate and simplify financial transactions on a global scale. For instance, digital
payment systems enable seamless cross-border financial transactions, contributing
positively to the growth of e-commerce and international trade. Additionally, the
advancement of financial technologies increases access to global markets, supports financial
inclusion, and creates new opportunities for individuals and small businesses, particularly in
developing countries.
Economic Impact: Activities such as financial process optimization and cost analysis help
companies reduce costs and increase profitability. These engineering solutions, which
enhance efficiency, boost the competitiveness of companies and contribute to economic
growth. Moreover, improvements in budgeting and cost management processes lead to
more efficient use of resources, supporting the operational sustainability of the company.
These economic impacts contribute to the growth of the company and its ability to maintain
a competitive advantage in the industry.
Environmental Impact: The environmental impact of engineering solutions should also be
considered. For example, process improvement activities can lead to more efficient use of
resources, reducing energy consumption and waste production. This supports
environmental sustainability and reduces the company’s carbon footprint. The adoption of
eco-friendly practices by technology companies like Ozan Electronics contributes to
increased environmental awareness and the proliferation of sustainable business models.
Societal Impact: The societal impact of financial technologies is also significant. The
widespread adoption of digital payment systems and financial services increases financial
accessibility, allowing a broader range of people to benefit from these services. This is
especially advantageous for individuals who have limited or no access to banking services.
Additionally, engineering solutions that increase workforce efficiency improve working
conditions and raise employee satisfaction. These societal impacts highlight the importance
of addressing engineering solutions not only from an economic perspective but also with a
sense of social responsibility.
In evaluating these four main areas, it is clear that engineering activities do not merely solve
technical problems but also have wide-ranging impacts globally, economically,
environmentally, and socially. The understanding I gained during my internship at Ozan
Electronics has enhanced my ability to assess the multifaceted effects of engineering
solutions.

b. Team Work (maximum one page)
Developing a solid understanding and positive attitude towards team work is central
for all real life applications.

 Describe the team work that you have participated (or at least observed) during your
summer practice, and
 Give positions and majors of the people and describe the contribution of each person
and yourself in the team;
 Evaluate the composition, organization, and performance of your team.
• Teamwork played a major role during my internship at Ozan Electronics. One of
the key projects I observed was optimizing the monthly financial close process. This
project required close collaboration across departments and provided valuable
insights into how interdisciplinary teamwork can increase efficiency and innovation.
• Team Composition: The team consisted of professionals from different
departments, each bringing unique expertise to the project:
• Project Manager (Finance Department): The project manager was responsible for
overseeing the entire process, coordinating tasks, and ensuring deadlines were met.
Their background in finance guided the financial analysis and reporting processes.
• Senior Accountant (Finance Department): The senior accountant focused on data
validation and ensuring the accuracy of financial statements. Their deep
understanding of accounting principles was crucial to maintaining the integrity of
financial reports.
• Data Analyst (Data Analytics Department): The data analyst was responsible for
collecting and processing large financial data sets. Their technical skills with data
analysis tools and software such as Excel and SQL allowed them to identify patterns
and trends that were important for making informed decisions.
• Software Engineer (IT Department): The software engineer played a key role in
automating certain parts of the closing process, such as data entry and report
generation. Their expertise in programming and systems integration ensured that
the tools used were efficient and reliable.
• My Role (Intern - Industrial Engineering): To conduct observations.
• Team Performance and Evaluation: The team was well-formed, with each member
bringing a specific skill set that complemented the others. The interdisciplinary
nature of the team provided a holistic approach to problem solving and ensured that
all aspects of the project were covered comprehensively. Communication was open
and frequent, facilitating quick decision-making and allowing the team to adapt to
challenges as they arose.
• The organization of the team was hierarchical yet flexible. While the project
manager served as the central coordinator, each member was given autonomy in
their areas of expertise. This structure allowed for efficient delegation of tasks and
minimized bottlenecks, contributing to the overall success of the project. • When
evaluating the team's performance, it is clear that the collaborative environment
and the diverse skill sets of the team members are important factors in achieving
the project's goals. The experience highlighted the importance of teamwork in
achieving complex goals and strengthened my understanding of how effective
collaboration can lead to innovative solutions in a real-world setting.

c. Self-directed Learning (minimum one page)

Developing a positive attitude to self-directed and lifelong learning with the aim of
improving knowledge, skills and competencies is important both for personal and professional
reasons.
Based on your internship experience,
 Identify additional knowledge, skills, and attitudes that would be appropriate for
professional practice;
 Explain the additional information you needed to analyze the activity, conduct the
project;
 Explain how you managed to collect the relevant information.
 Based on my internship experience, I identified several areas of additional
knowledge, skills, and attitudes that would be beneficial for professional
practice. Firstly, proficiency in financial software, particularly LOGO, is
crucial for efficiently managing financial processes. Gaining a deeper
understanding of how this software integrates various financial tasks, such as
invoicing, expense management, and reconciliation, would enhance my
ability to perform these tasks more effectively. Additionally, developing
advanced Excel skills is essential, as it is frequently used for organizing and
analyzing financial data. This includes not only basic data entry but also
creating complex formulas, pivot tables, and financial models that can
streamline processes and provide valuable insights.
 To analyze activities and conduct projects, I realized the importance of
understanding financial regulations and accounting principles, especially as
they apply to different types of invoices and expense reports. This knowledge
is necessary to ensure that all financial records are accurate, compliant, and
up-to-date.
 To collect the relevant information, I actively engaged in self-directed
learning. I utilized online resources, including tutorials and guides specific to
LOGO and Excel, to improve my technical skills. Additionally, I sought
advice from colleagues and supervisors whenever I encountered unfamiliar
tasks. Their practical insights and experiences provided me with valuable
context that supplemented my learning. Furthermore, I reviewed company
documentation, such as financial policies and procedures, to ensure that my
work aligned with organizational standards and practices. This approach not
only helped me complete my tasks effectively but also prepared me for future
challenges in professional practice.

On my first day, I was introduced to the company by Ms. Şeyma from the Human Resources
department. She gave me a tour of the office, showing me the different departments and
introducing me to the key personnel. This provided me with a solid understanding of the
workplace environment and the team dynamics. Figure 1 shows a view from the office.
Figure 1
After the tour, I met with Ms. Tuğçe, who explained the tasks I would be performing during
the internship. She gave me an overview of the company’s principles and expectations. My
first assignment was to learn how to read invoices and receipts, a task essential for
organizing financial documents. Using the information provided, I organized the documents
accordingly and began to familiarize myself with the company’s filing system. Figure 2 shows
my first completed file editing task.

company's established filing system. This process was essential for maintaining accurate
financial records, and it provided me with a deeper understanding of the importance of
meticulous document management in a corporate environment. Throughout this activity, I
focused on ensuring that all documents were properly sorted and easily retrievable, which is
crucial for the efficient operation of the finance department.
Later in the day, I was introduced to the LOGO software, which the accounting department
relies on for various financial and accounting operations. LOGO is an integrated business

the generation of comprehensive reports. I spent a significant amount of time learning how
to navigate the software, understanding its key features, and familiarizing myself with its
interface. I observed how LOGO is used to input financial data, track expenses, and manage
accounts. Additionally, I took detailed notes to ensure I could effectively utilize the software
in future tasks. This introduction to LOGO was a valuable learning experience, as it equipped
me with practical skills that are directly applicable to the financial tasks I will be performing
during my internship.

On the third day, I focused on gaining a deeper understanding of the company's financial
and accounting processes. At the beginning of the day, I learned how reconciliation
processes are conducted. Reconciliation is the process of comparing the company's internal
financial records with external statements, usually bank statements, to ensure consistency
and accuracy. This process helps identify potential errors or discrepancies in financial data
and enhances the reliability of the company's financial reports. To better understand these
processes, I reviewed the relevant documents and learned the steps involved in
reconciliation. Then, I learned how to prepare reconciliation reports and had the
opportunity to practice this process firsthand. Throughout the day, I took notes on these
procedures and gained valuable insights into how they ensure the accuracy of financial
reporting.

On the 7th day, the CEO, managers, and employees brought in receipts for the
expenses they incurred during the month. I carefully reviewed each receipt and
organized them in chronological order. This sorting was crucial for ensuring accurate
tracking and processing of the expenses.
After organizing the receipts by date, I created an expense form in an Excel
spreadsheet. In this spreadsheet, I included details of each expense, such as the date of
the receipt, the type of expense, the amount, and the names of the individuals who
incurred the expense. I used Excel's filtering and sorting features to make the expense
form more organized and comprehensible. Additionally, I performed necessary
summary calculations to review all expense items collectively.
Once these tasks were completed, I proceeded to create the expense invoices using the
LOGO software. Using LOGO, I entered the information from the receipts into the
system and generated the expense invoices. During this process, I utilized LOGO’s
expense invoice creation features to accurately record each receipt in the system and
verify their accuracy. I also employed LOGO’s validation and approval mechanisms
to ensure that the expense invoices were correctly generated.
By the end of the day, I verified the accuracy of both the expense form and the LOGO
expense invoices, making any necessary adjustments. This task was crucial for
managing expenses and maintaining up-to-date financial records, and it significantly
enhanced my understanding of how to use both Excel and LOGO. This experience
demonstrated the importance of meticulous data management in accounting processes
and the impact of accurate receipt processing on financial reporting. Figure 6 shows
the expense invoice interface of Logo.
Figure 5

On the 8th day, I was tasked with analyzing the company's monthly budget versus actual
expenses. I used Excel to compile data from various departments, which involved gathering
expense reports and inputting the figures into a comprehensive spreadsheet.
In Excel, I created a detailed comparison table that listed the budgeted amounts alongside
the actual expenses for each category. I utilized formulas to calculate variances, which
highlighted any significant differences between the budgeted and actual amounts.
Additionally, I used Excel's conditional formatting to visually distinguish areas where
expenses exceeded the budget, making it easier to identify potential issues.
To provide a clearer overview, I created charts and graphs within Excel that visually
represented the data. These visual aids were particularly useful for quickly assessing overall
financial performance and identifying trends. After completing the analysis, I prepared a
summary report that outlined the key findings and any areas of concern.
This task not only improved my Excel skills, particularly in data analysis and visualization, but
also deepened my understanding of the importance of budget management within a
company.

After collecting the invoices, I carefully examined each one and made the necessary
adjustments. I meticulously carried out the review process to ensure that the invoices
contained the correct date and amount information. Additionally, I checked that foreign
invoices from different currencies were accurately recorded and converted using the
appropriate exchange rates.
After correcting any missing or incorrect information, I organized all the invoices properly
within the file and archived the documents in an orderly manner. This process helped me
understand once again the importance of having accurate and complete documents. It also
gave me valuable experience in working with different currencies and integrating this
information into the accounting system.

On the 10th day, since my supervisor was working from home, I also participated online.
During our session, my supervisor explained how to enter foreign invoices into the system
using the LOGO software.
First, she demonstrated how to access the foreign invoice entry section in LOGO. We began
by selecting the appropriate currency for each invoice and entering the necessary exchange
rates, ensuring that all financial data were accurately converted to our local currency. My
supervisor emphasized the importance of verifying the invoice details, such as the invoice
number, date, and total amount, to avoid any discrepancies.
Next, she showed me how to categorize the invoices according to their nature (e.g., services,
goods) and assign them to the correct accounts within the system. We also discussed the
importance of attaching any relevant documentation, such as purchase orders or shipping
documents, to ensure a comprehensive audit trail.
Finally, I learned how to save and archive the entered invoices properly, making sure they
were easily accessible for future reference. This session provided me with a deeper
understanding of how to handle foreign invoices in a professional accounting environment
and reinforced the importance of accuracy and attention to detail when working with
